newsitem.title: BRAZIL: BRAZIL JULY COFFEE EXPORTS 916,598 BAGS - FEBEC.
newsitem.headline: BRAZIL JULY COFFEE EXPORTS 916,598 BAGS - FEBEC.

text.p: Brazil exported 916,598 60-kg bags of coffee, ground and in beans, in July, down from an adjusted June figure of 1.00 million bags, said Federation of Coffee Exporters (Febec).
Previously, Febec estimated June exports at 998,850 bags. The July total is also below the 1.16 million bags exported in the same month in 1996.
Brazilian exports so far this year are 8.49 million bags, up from 4.92 million bags shipped by July 1996.
The July 1997 sales brought total earnings from coffee exports so far this year to $1.58 billion, 123 percent higher than the $708.93 million earned in the same period in 1996.
Revenue last month was $187.85 million against $152.15 million in July last year and $219.31 in June 1997. The average price per bag fell to $204.95 in July from $217.84 in June, Febec said.
Of July's total, 818,533 bags were arabica coffee, while shipments of conillon reached 98,065 bags.
